intro: Solenanthus nigricans, commonly known as the black-flowered solenanthus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. Solenanthus nigricans is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and environmental changes.
